Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the IAD's determination on the genuineness of the marriage was unreasonable
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations (IRPR)
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Appeal following visa officer’s refusal of permanent residence application
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: IAD found the marriage not credible despite submitted evidence
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA and IRPR provisions on genuine relationships
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Marriage was genuine and not entered for immigration purposes
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Applicant's intent to stay in Canada
Crimes.Regulation_Cited: IRPR sections related to spousal sponsorship and genuineness
Crimes.Application_Factor: Marriage must be genuine and not primarily for immigration benefit
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA section on sponsored spouse eligibility, IRPR provisions on relationship genuineness
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Doubts about the genuineness of the marriage
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPR Section 300.1 – factors for assessing genuineness of marriage
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Conflicting evidence on cohabitation and relationship authenticity
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: No procedural unfairness found by the court
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Inconsistencies in timeline and lack of third-party corroboration
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to IAD decision on grounds of unreasonableness
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Standard of review applicable to IAD decisions
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to provide sufficient proof of shared life

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Immigration appeal concerning marriage fraud allegations
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the IAD's determination on the genuineness of the marriage was unreasonable
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations (IRPR)
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Appeal after visa officer refused permanent residence over marriage fraud concerns
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: IAD concluded marriage lacked credibility based on behavioral indicators
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA and IRPR requirements for genuine marital relationships
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Marriage was legitimate and not a sham for immigration benefits
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Applicant's intent to remain in Canada
Crimes.Application_Factor: Marriage must not be entered solely or primarily to obtain immigration status
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Reasonableness of IAD’s conclusion on marriage fraud
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA Section 4(1)(d) – misrepresentation; IRPR Section 300.1 – genuineness criteria
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient independent evidence supporting relationship authenticity
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Process deemed fair; no breach found
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Doubts about authenticity due to limited interaction evidence
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Argument that IAD decision was unreasonable
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Scope of judicial review over administrative decisions
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to demonstrate shared life and emotional connection
